meanings.sent1: The farmer raised capons for their tender meat.
meanings.sent2: The capon strutted around the farmyard, showing off his feathers.
meanings.sent3: Why did the capon refuse to fight? Because he had nothing to crow about!
meanings.sent4: The capon stood out among the regular roosters, his demeanor more refined.
meanings.sent5: The capon's crow was softer and more melodious than the other roosters'.

meanings.sent1: The farmer decided to capon the rooster to prevent aggression.
meanings.sent2: They had to capon the rooster to maintain peace in the coop.
meanings.sent3: The rooster was not happy after they decided to capon him.
meanings.sent4: Caponing the rooster was a delicate procedure that required skill.
meanings.sent5: After they caponed the rooster, he became more docile and less noisy.
